New Records: Rachin Ravindra brought up his third century of the World Cup
Key Match Events: Rachin Ravindra scored 105, Kane Williamson scored 95, Fakhar Zaman smashed an unbeaten 126 in 81 balls, New Zealand put on 140 runs in the 14.1 overs since Ravindra fell, Fakhar Zaman's onslaught against Trent Boult made his intentions clear, Fakhar brought up his half-century with a late cut off Ish Sodhi off 39 balls, Fakhar smacked Santner for his ninth six of the innings and was suddenly one ball away from three figures, Fakhar smacked Santner for his 10th six of the innings and brought up a phenomenal 62-ball hundred
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan's decision to field first after winning the toss raised eyebrows on a flat wicket, suggesting they had as much of an eye on improving their net run rate as they did putting points on the board
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan remain alive in this World Cup, their win levels them on points with New Zealand and puts a semi-final berth within realistic grasp, Pakistan were fined 10% of their match fees for maintaining a slow over rate
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan were found to be three overs short at the cut-off time and, as a result, they had to have one less fielder outside the inner ring for the last three overs of the innings that went for 35, the rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 25.3 overs per side, Pakistan were comfortably ahead of the rate they needed to be when the rain arrived
